page.title: 06 TRANSPORT
page.content: {Rail} There are many trains that pass through our area every day,some stop at Bruton while others like the inter-city trains travel at high speed to London.Passenger and freight trains are often seen. {Road The A359 leads to Frome.It's a fairly busy main road.Quaperlake St.is part of the main road which is narrow and bendy in places and therefore awkward for heavy traffic to drive along.At the top of Quaperlake St.the road takes a sharp,left bend near'The Old Toll House'.This name suggests that at one time travellers had to pay to use the road.Other roads in our area are the B3081 to Evercreech and various country lanes that are narrow and hilly in places.These lanes are used a lot by farmers to get to their fields.
